ServerSettings.description: Specifies the order and which mods are loaded. ModIDs are comma separated on one line with no spaces. Priority is descending (left-most has highest priority). Alternatively, the command line ?GameModIds= can be used.
Specifies the mod ID for the currently active mod map.
Used to specify a total conversion mod (e.g., Primitive Plus). Alternatively, the command line -TotalConversionMod=<ModID> can be used.
If True, logs all admin commands to in-game chat.
If True, allows anyone to 'take care' of a baby creature (e.g., cuddle), not just the one who imprinted on it.
If True, allows building in caves when PvE mode is enabled. (Note: Not working in command-line options before patch 241.5.)
If False, prevents building in caves when PvP mode is enabled.
If True, allows supply crates to spawn on top of structures rather than being blocked by them.
If True, allows cryofridges to be built on platform saddles and rafts.
If True, allows flying creatures to pick up wild creatures in PvE.
If True, allows the server to recover stamina when a flyer is stationary.
If False, displays damage source details in tribe logs.
If False, disables optional hit markers for ranged attacks.
If False, disables all new S+ structures, intended for unofficial servers that wish to keep using the older S+ mod version.
If True, allows attaching more than one C4 per creature.
If True, allows Titanosaurs to be permanently tamed by feeding. (Note: On The Island only 3 Titanosaurs spawn, so 3 tamed should block further spawns.)
If True, allows family sharing players to connect to the server.
If True, enables TEK suit powers in Genesis: Part 1.
If False, disables the default third-person camera on dedicated servers.
If True, disables the timer on the quick pick-up system, allowing immediate structure pickup.
If True, always notifies players when someone leaves the server.
If True, automatically destroys claimable decayed tames on load. (Note: In PvE mode, post-patch 273.691, the auto-unclaim after decay is disabled on official servers.)

Multiplier for auto-destruction of structures after a period of no nearby tribe activity. Set to 1.0 to enable. Requires the -AutoDestroyStructures command line option. The multiplier scales with each structure's decay time.
Sets the interval in minutes for automatic saves. Setting to 0 will cause constant saving.
Specifies the URL for the global ban list. Must be enclosed in double quotes. For ARK: Survival Evolved, official URLs vary by version and support only HTTP or both HTTP and HTTPS.
If True, allows flyers to be used on maps where they are normally disabled. (If False, flyers are disabled on any map.)
If True, clamps all item spoiling times to their maximum values. Useful to clean up infinite-spoiling exploits, but may conflict with mods altering spoiling times.
If True, enables clamping of item stats. See ItemStatClamps for more details.
If True, limits the damage dealt by a tame to a resource based on the resource's remaining health. May reduce yields with high-damage tools or creatures.
Specifies the URL to a comma-separated list of whitelisted custom cosmetics in the format: Mod ID|Enable Dynamic Download (0/1)|Allow non-dataonly blueprints (0/1)|Calculated package CRC.

Direct URL to a live dynamicconfig.ini file for live configuration updates without a server restart. Requires the -UseDynamicConfig command line option. Must use HTTP and be enclosed in quotes if used on the command line.

Direct URL to the live tuning file. For ARK: Survival Evolved, official URL is typically http://arkdedicated.com/DefaultOverloads.json; for ARK: Survival Ascended, it is https://cdn2.arkdedicated.com/asa/livetuningoverloads.json. Must use HTTP for Evolved and be enclosed in quotes if used on the command line.

Specifies the scaling factor for the overall day/night cycle. The default (1.0) gives the same speed as single-player. Lower values slow the cycle; higher values accelerate it. For a 24-hour in-game cycle, a value of approximately 0.035 is used.
Specifies the scaling factor for day time relative to night time (as determined by NightTimeSpeedScale). Lower values increase the length of each day.
If True, water pipes that are unconnected to any non-pipe or nearby allied player will auto-destroy after two real-time days.
Specifies an offset for the server difficulty level.
Scaling factor for the food consumption rate of creatures. Higher values increase consumption and affect taming times.
Scaling factor for the health recovery rate of creatures. Higher values accelerate healing.
Scaling factor for the stamina drain of creatures. Higher values increase stamina consumption.
Scaling factor for the number of creatures spawned. Higher values result in more spawns.
Scaling factor for the damage dealt by wild creatures. Higher values increase damage; lower values decrease it.
Scaling factor for the resistance of wild creatures to damage. Higher values decrease resistance (increasing damage per attack); lower values increase resistance.
If True, creatures above the soft tame limit are marked for cryopodding and will be automatically destroyed after a countdown. Such events are logged in the tribe log.
If True, allows cryopods to be used even when enemies are nearby.
If True, allows cryopods to be used without being near a powered cryofridge.
If True, disables creature decay in PvE mode. (Note: After patch 273.691, official PvE servers disable auto-unclaim of tames after decay.)
If True, disables the bonus stat buff given to the creature that imprinted on a baby.
If True, prevents the use of the console command 'gamma' in PvE mode.
If True, disables the gradual auto-decay of player structures.
If True, disables fog.
If True, globally disables notifications when players join the server.
If True, disables building in certain resource-rich areas (e.g., around major mountains on The Island).
If True, allows the use of the console command 'gamma' in PvP mode.
Specifies the interval in seconds for the extinction mode (ARKpocalypse). For 30 days, use 2592000.
If True, unsnapped foundations/pillars/fences/Tek Dedicated Storage decay after the FastDecayInterval (default 12 hours).
If True, forces all structures to be locked by default.
If True, enables global voice chat.
Scaling factor for yields from harvesting activities. Higher values increase yields.
Scaling factor for the durability of harvestable items. Higher values increase the number of strikes required to harvest.
If True, removes the limit on decorative structures (e.g., flags, signs).
Defines the cooldown (in seconds) between uses of the implant's 'Respawn' feature.
Global multiplier for item stack sizes (applies to all items except those with a default stack size of 1).
Time (in seconds) after which inactive characters are kicked. Although defined as a float, it is suggested to use an integer.
Defines the maximum number of gateways allowed on platform saddles. A value of 0 disallows gateways.
Specifies the maximum number of hexagons a character can accumulate. Officially set to 2500000.
Sets a per-tribe tame limit (e.g., 500 for official PvE, 300 for official PvP). A default of 0 disables the limit.
Changes the maximum number of platform saddles/rafts allowed. For example, 10 would restrict to 10 structures.
Global cap for the maximum number of tamed creatures. Although defined as a float, it is suggested to treat it as an integer.
Defines the soft tame limit for the server.
Time in seconds before tamed creatures above the soft tame limit are destroyed.
Defines the maximum number of train cars a train can have.
Specifies the number of slots for uploaded characters. Lower values will be reverted; increasing may risk data corruption.
Specifies the number of slots for uploaded creatures. Lower values will be reverted; some suggest a safe cap is 273.
Specifies the number of slots for uploaded items/resources. Lower values will be reverted; some suggest a safe cap is 154.
Scaling factor for the passage of time during night. Lower values increase night length relative to day.
If True, makes diseases that are normally permanent become temporary (lost upon respawn).
Minimum number of online players required for NPC Network Stasis Range scaling to take effect (INI only; official value is 24).
Maximum number of online players for NPC Network Stasis Range scaling (INI only; official value is 70).
Maximum scale percentage for NPC Network Stasis Range when the player count reaches the end value (INI only; official value is 0.5).
If True, prevents auto-destruction of any non-core or non-foundation structures. (Used on Official PvE servers.)
If True, only unsnapped core structures will decay, helping reduce spam of lone pillars or foundations.
Overrides the default server difficulty level. A value of 0.0 disables the override; a value of 5.0 will allow common creatures to spawn up to level 150.
If True, allows turrets to be built and function on platform saddles. (Note: In ShooterGameServer it's spelled with two 'r's.)
Sets how swim speed is multiplied by the level of oxygen spent. The value was reduced by 80% in patch 256.0.
Multiplier (percentage scale) that increases the maximum number of items placeable on saddles and rafts.
Determines how many 'tame creature slots' a platform saddle (with structures) will consume toward the tribe tame limit.
Multiplier that increases the build area bounds for platform saddles, allowing structures to be placed further away.
Scaling factor for player characters' food consumption; higher values cause faster hunger.
Scaling factor for player characters' health recovery; higher values increase the recovery rate.
Scaling factor for player characters' stamina consumption; higher values result in faster stamina drain.
Scaling factor for player characters' water consumption; higher values cause faster thirst.
Scaling factor for the damage players deal. Higher values increase damage; lower values decrease it.
Scaling factor for the resistance to damage players receive. A value of 0.5 means half damage taken; 2.0 means double damage.
If True, prevents diseases from being permanent.
If True, disables creature mate boosting.

If True, enables Offline Raiding Prevention (ORP), making tribe characters, creatures, and structures invulnerable when all tribe members are offline. Works for both PvE and PvP; it is recommended to set a minimum interval with PreventOfflinePvPInterval.
Time in seconds to wait before ORP becomes active for a tribe/players and related entities. Although defined as a float, an integer is suggested.
If True, player characters respawn without the wake-up animation.
If True, prevents tribes from forming alliances.
If True, only players near each other can see their chat messages.
If True, allows building near supply drop points in PvE mode.
Scaling factor for the auto-decay period of creatures in PvE; lower values cause faster decay. Requires DisableDinoDecayPvE to be false.
Scaling factor for structure decay times; for example, 2.0 doubles the decay time and 0.5 halves it. Applies in both PvP and PvE when enabled.
If True, enables creature decay in PvP mode while Offline Raid Prevention is active.
If True, enables structure decay on PvP servers while Offline Raid Prevention is active.
Scaling factor for the food drain rate on raid dinos (e.g., Titanosaurus).
If True, supply drops spawn at random locations. (May cause artifacts on Ragnarok.)
If True, enables RCON functionality. Requires RCONPort and ServerAdminPassword to be set.
Specifies the TCP port for RCON.
Specifies the number of game log lines sent over RCON. Though coded as a float, it should be treated as an integer.
Scaling factor for the respawn rate of resource nodes; lower values cause more frequent respawns.
If specified, players must enter this password via the in-game console to access administrator commands. Do not use quotes.
Forces a re-spawn of all wild creatures on server restart after the specified number of seconds; 0.0 disables it.
If False, disables the server crosshair.
If True, forces the HUD to be disabled for non-tribe owned NPCs.
If True, enables Hardcore mode, causing player characters to revert to level 1 upon death.
If specified, players must enter this password to join the server. Do not use quotes.
If True, disables PvP and enables PvE mode.
If True, enables RPG-style popup damage text.
If False, hides players' precise map locations.
Password for non-admin spectators; clients use console commands 'requestspectator <password>' and 'stopspectating'. Do not use quotes.
Scaling factor for the damage that structures (e.g., spiked walls) deal. Higher values increase damage; lower values decrease it.
Specifies the hold duration for quick structure pickup; a value of 0 results in instant pickup.
Time in seconds after placement during which quick pickup is available.
Multiplier equivalent to ResourceNoReplenishRadiusStructures in Game.ini. Applied in addition to INI settings; useful when the Game.ini cannot be modified.
Scaling factor for the resistance of structures to damage. Higher values decrease resistance (increasing damage taken); lower values increase resistance.
Scaling factor for damage dealt by tamed creatures. Higher values increase damage; lower values decrease it.
Scaling factor for the resistance of tamed creatures. Higher values decrease resistance (increasing damage taken); lower values increase it.
Scaling factor for creature taming speed. Higher values speed up taming.
Specifies the maximum number of structures that can be built within a certain range. Replaces the old NewMaxStructuresInRange value.
If True, logs enemy structure destruction events in the tribe logs.
Cooldown time (in minutes) between tribe name changes. Official servers use 172800.0 (2 days).
If True, enables the Fjordur biome teleport when holding R, as used on official PvE servers.
If True, enables an optimized harvesting algorithm with a high HarvestAmountMultiplier but fewer rare items. Suggested for use when Tek Stryder causes lag spikes.
Scaling factor for experience gained by players, tribes, and tames. Higher values increase XP, lower values decrease it. (Note: In patch 313.5 an additional multiplier of 4 was applied.)
If True, enables non-native creature tribute downloads on Aberration.
Specifies the cooldown in seconds between allowed creature re-uploads (default is 43200 seconds or 12 hours on official servers).
If True, prevents CrossARK data downloads in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents creature downloads from ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents item downloads from ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents survivor downloads from ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents creature uploads to ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents item uploads to ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
If True, prevents survivor uploads to ARK Data in Cross-ARK Data Transfer.
Sets the expiration timer in seconds for uploaded survivors in ARK Data. A default or negative value means no expiration. It is recommended to use the same value across servers in a cluster.
Sets the expiration timer in seconds for uploaded tames in ARK Data. A value of 0 or less reverts to default. Use the same value across servers in a cluster to avoid data deletion.
Sets the expiration timer in seconds for uploaded items in ARK Data. A value of 0 or less reverts to default. Use the same value across servers in a cluster to avoid data deletion.
Reduces the damage dealt by a creature after being deployed from a cryopod as a percentage of total damage. For example, 0.01 means 99% of the damage is removed. (Official value is 0.1.)
Duration in seconds for which the cryopod nerf (or 'Cryosickness') lasts after deployment. Although defined as float, it is suggested to use an integer. (Official value is 10.0.)

Increases the damage taken by a creature after deployment from a cryopod, as a percentage of total damage received, for the duration specified. For example, 0.25 means a 25% increase. (Official value is 0.25.)
If True, enables cryopod nerf behavior. When set, CryopodNerfDuration and CryopodNerfIncomingDamageMultPercent must be specified (or default to 0).
If True, enables the cryopod cooldown timer when deploying a creature.
URL for the server's bad words list. For ARK: Survival Evolved, only the HTTP protocol is supported (HTTPS will not work).
URL for the server's good words list. For ARK: Survival Evolved, only the HTTP protocol is supported (HTTPS will not work).
If True, filters out character names based on the bad/good words list.
If True, filters chat messages based on the bad/good words list.
If True, filters tribe names based on the bad/good words list.
Alternative to AllowedCheaterAccountIDs.txt (see Administrator Whitelisting) using a web resource. The update interval is defined by UpdateAllowedCheatersInterval. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)

Alternative to AllowedCheaterSteamIDs.txt (see Administrator Whitelisting) using a web resource (e.g., official uses http://arkdedicated.com/globaladmins.txt). The update interval is defined by UpdateAllowedCheatersInterval. Supports HTTP only. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Defines the time (in seconds) after which the server will automatically restart. (Appears to shut off the server instead of restarting properly.)
Controls how often (in seconds) the chat log file is split. Cannot be set lower than 45 (will default to 45 if lower) and should be 0 only on official servers. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)

Controls the interval (in seconds) at which the chat log is flushed to file. Cannot be set lower than 15 (defaults to 15 if lower) and should be 0 only on official servers. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Controls the maximum age (in days) of the chat log. Setting a negative value results in -1 (virtually infinite), and 0 should be used only on official servers. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If True and -DisableDupeLogDeletes is present, prevents the server from automatically restoring a backup in case of a corrupted save. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)

Enables idle timeout only if the percentage of online players (relative to MaxPlayers) reaches this value (normalized between 0 and 1.0). Officially set to approximately 0.9. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If False, disables mesh biting protection. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If True, freezes the Reaper King pregnancy timer and experience gain. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)

If True, enables advanced chat logging. Chat logs are saved in ShooterGame/Saved/Logs/ChatLogs/<SessionName>/ in JSON format. Files are split and flushed based on ChatLogFileSplitIntervalSeconds and ChatLogFlushIntervalSeconds. <SessionName> is written without spaces. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Defines the maximum number of structures allowed within a certain radius (specified by RadiusStructuresInSmallRadius) from a player's position. Official value is 40. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)

Controls the maximum batch size of structures to process per server tick (for culling, building graphs, etc.). A value of 0 forces processing of all queued structures; official value is 5000. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If True, prevents players outside of a tribe from using pin codes on structures (doors, elevators, storage boxes, etc.). (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Defines the small radius (in Unreal Units) used for limiting structures (used in conjunction with MaxStructuresInSmallRadius). Official value is 225.0. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Involved in foliage repopulation; takes no effect if -forcedisablemeshchecking is set. Enabled on official servers. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If False, prevents tribes from merging. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Cooldown (in seconds) between tribe mergers. Official value is 86400.0. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Specifies the interval (in seconds) at which the remote admin list (linked via AllowedCheatersURL) is queried for updates. Values less than 3.0 will be reverted to 3.0. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
Enables character tracking. Alternatively, this can be set via the -disableCharacterTracker command line argument, which takes precedence over this setting. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
If True, allows behavior similar to -exclusivejoin. (Undocumented by Wildcard.)
